intro: Dracocephalum ghahremanii, commonly known as Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. It produces blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
